login_by_digest.summary: Checks user credentials via digest authentication and returns the login status, including password strength and account lock status.

request.body: No body required. Authentication is handled via Digest Auth headers.

response.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<userCheck xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema" version="2.0">
    
    <statusValue>
        200
    </statusValue>
    <statusString>
        OK
    </statusString>
    <isDefaultPassword>
        true
    </isDefaultPassword>
    <isRiskPassword>
        true
    </isRiskPassword>
    <isActivated>
        true
    </isActivated>
    <residualValidity>
        0
    </residualValidity>
    <lockStatus>
        unlock
    </lockStatus>
    <unlockTime>
        1
    </unlockTime>
    <retryLoginTime>
        1
    </retryLoginTime>
</userCheck>

status_codes.meaning: OK (Indicates successful HTTP transaction; check statusValue in body for auth result)

set_single_user.summary: Sets or modifies information for a single user account. Requires administrator password confirmation within the request body for security.

request.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<User xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema" version="2.0">
    
    <id>
        1
    </id>
    <enabled>
        true
    </enabled>
    <userName>
        test
    </userName>
    <password>
        test
    </password>
    <userLevel>
        Administrator
    </userLevel>
    <loginPassword>
        King726014
    </loginPassword>
</User>

response.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ResponseStatus xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema" version="2.0">
    
    <requestURL>
        null
    </requestURL>
    <statusCode>
        0
    </statusCode>
    <statusString>
        OK
    </statusString>
    <subStatusCode>
        OK
    </subStatusCode>
    <lockStatus>
        lock
    </lockStatus>
    <retryTimes>
        1
    </retryTimes>
</ResponseStatus>

get_single_user.summary: Retrieves the configuration details for a specific user, excluding sensitive information like passwords.

response.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<User xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema" version="2.0">
    
    <id>
        1
    </id>
    <enabled>
        true
    </enabled>
    <userName>
        test
    </userName>
    <userLevel>
        Administrator
    </userLevel>
    <userActivationStatus>
        true
    </userActivationStatus>
    
</User>

get_single_user_capabilities.summary: Retrieves the configuration capabilities for a user, such as field constraints (min/max length) and allowed values for enumerated fields.

response.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<User xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema" version="2.0">
    
    <id min="1" max="64">
        1
    </id>
    <enabled opt="true, false">
        true
    </enabled>
    <userName min="1" max="32">
        test
    </userName>
    <password min="1" max="16">
        null
    </password>
    <userLevel opt="Administrator, Operator, Viewer, installer, manufacturer, single, installerAdmin, installEmployee, Employee, DepartmentManager">
        Administrator
    </userLevel>
    
</User>

get_all_users.summary: Retrieves a list of all user accounts configured on the device.

response.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<UserList xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema" version="2.0">
    
    <User>
        
        <id>
            1
        </id>
        <enabled>
            true
        </enabled>
        <userName>
            test
        </userName>
        <userLevel>
            Administrator
        </userLevel>
        
    </User>
    
</UserList>

set_all_users.summary: Sets or modifies information for multiple users in a single batch request. Requires administrator password confirmation.

request.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<UserList xmlns="http://www.isapi.org/ver20/XMLSchema" version="2.0">
    
    <User>
        
        <id>
            1
        </id>
        <enabled>
            true
        </enabled>
        <userName>
            test
        </userName>
        <password>
            test
        </password>
        <userLevel>
            Administrator
        </userLevel>
        <loginPassword>
            King726014
        </loginPassword>
    </User>
    
</UserList>
